glosses: to run down, point out the faults of, criticize, speak ill of

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish یرمك (yermek, “loathe; blame”), from Proto-Turkic *yẹr- (“to hate”). Cognate with Kazakh жеру (jeru), Southern Altai јериир (ǰeriir, “to hate”), Old Turkic [script needed] (yer-, “to hate, dispraise”),
, Yakut сир (sir, “to disdain, dislike, reject”).
